pageContext.claim: “'Jewish people are leaving the Democratic Party. We saw a lot of anti Israel policies start under the Obama Administration, and it got worsts & worse. There is anti-Semitism in the Democratic Party. They don't care about Israel or the Jewish people.' Elizabeth Pipko, Jexodus.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump retweets a comment by a former staffer who is associated with a new group of "Jewish millennials" supposedly seeking to leave the Democratic Party. But there is no evidence there is a mass movement of Jews away from Democrats. If anything, the trend is the other way. In 2012, Jewish voters broke for Barack Obama over Mitt Romney, 69%-30%, in 2016, Jewish voters broke for Hillary Clinton over Trump, 71%-23%, and in 2018, Jewish voters broke for Democrats over GOP, 79%-17%.
